title: Impossible for a new player to play without getting banned?
body: I'm forced nearly every game I get to surrender or feed because team didn't surrender when we match up against smurfs, This gets me banned. I'm new and match making doesn't have a system to match me with other new players because every one makes new accounts so they can cheat the system to match up with players like me. I'm not encouraging these cheaters by playing them, but I'll get banned if I afk or leave so if Riot refuses to fix this problem how does any one expect lol to exist in a few years time? The community is just pushing away all new players and there's nothing I can do when there's no way to leave with out punishment? If any one has some tips for how to punish my team mates for not surrendering and encouraging these cheaters I'd love to hear it, so far all i can do is be toxic and I don't like it.

replies.body:
Toxicity is always a choice.

You can choose to give in to another's behaviour and be controlled by it, or you can learn to rise above it.

It doesn't take long now to reach lvl 30 and reach a point where the system places you with people of your own skill. Remember that the system learns, and it takes a while to do so, you cant just play 5 games and expect it to put you in exactly the right place.

As it happens, many people (myself included) see AFking and intentionally feeding to be a worse crime than smurfing, at least smurfs are still trying to play the game, they just aren't good enough to play at their own level.

The game isn't about you, there are 4 more people on your team who are trying to win. If the smurf has made the game un-enjoyable for you, thats not the be-all and end-all, there are still 4 more people who could still be enjoying themselves, and you going off and having a tantrum may satisfy your own personal gratification, but it just makes the game un-enjoyable for 4x as many people.

If you try to lead by example, inevitably some will follow, and the game will be a more enjoyable place for everyone.

Holy shit. 

"Toxicity is always a choice".

Nails it.

> It doesn't take long now to reach lvl 30 and reach a point where the system places you with people of your own skill. Remember that the system learns, and it takes a while to do so, you cant just play 5 games and expect it to put you in exactly the right place.

To expand on this, there are "pretty good detection methods" that Riot uses to identify smurfs and put them with other smurfs. WookieCookie stated (in an [old post](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/q/lets-talk-smurfs-snow-and-bans-ask-riot), though still relevant it seems) that, and I quote, "Instead of trying to restrict or prevent smurfs, various teams across Riot try to minimize issues caused by smurfing. For example, one of the teams that works on meta-game systems developed pretty good detection methods that quickly separate new players from experienced smurf accounts in the early levels. Within a few matches, smurf accounts only end up playing against other smurf accounts."

Though it seems "a few matches" may be a *bit* of an exaggeration, in some instances. It also seems like it may apply more to PvP matches, as opposed to Coop, and from what I can tell you've only had 2 PvP matches on the account you're using now (with a total of 19), according to OP.GG.

Give the system a bit of time to "catch up" and figure out where you're meant to be. Like Lord Sessh says, "it's not the be-all and end-all".
Please, if there's any champs I can play that can team kill my team mates that would be awesome. I think kench and ryze kinda can but right now I'm saving up to buy these champs and it's awhile away.
